conclusion: Analyze the paths of the liquid streams from points A, B, and C to determine which container they flow into.
The liquid from A flows downward and encounters a green baffle.
The green baffle directs the flow to the right.
The liquid continues to flow downward and enters container E.
The liquid from B flows downward and encounters a purple baffle.
The purple baffle directs the flow to the left.
The liquid continues to flow downward and enters container D.
The liquid from C flows downward and encounters a brown baffle.
The brown baffle directs the flow to the right.
The liquid continues to flow downward and enters container F.
Liquid from A flows into container E.
Liquid from B flows into container D.
Liquid from C flows into container F.
Final Answer: A → E, B → D, C → F
